text: Hi there!, how would you make the "thank you" page dynamic? I mean, the user needs to be redirected to a different thank you page according to what was selected in the form.
That would be done in JavaScript based on the selection.
It would be near impossible to ensure the content is updated in the HS db before to do smart content
Well maybe I don't even need smart content. It should be fine by just changing the redirect url
Yeah. I'd do that using JavaScript listening for change in the select value

Hi all,
I have a question for an automation, always if it is possible: In a form I have a select field with the cities in which the user chooses his location; Is it possible to send an email to the salesman of the location chosen by the user? Ex: if the user chooses the location San Francisco, an email is sent to <mailto:sanfrancisco@company.com|sanfrancisco@company.com>?
Thankx
Thank you <@U26BLKGE4>
not the best solution but put `$(window).load(function(){` in place of `$(document).ready(function() {`

You can achieve this using the HubSpot workflows. You will create a workflow that listens to the form submissions from a certain page or just listen to submissions from a certain form then check if a submitted value of the location field matches San Francisco then trigger a certain email to a certain salesman

where *abc* and *snakd* are the values selected or entered on the form right?

You must set your form to show a thanks for submitting message for this solution to work instead of the form redirecting to a specific url or page.

Reposting here because its also a General question on video hosting with HubSpot. Despite my use case being hubDB

"ALL images that are not vector, HS converts to webp automatically if the user’s web browser supports webp.

If the web browser doesn’t support WebP, they get the format that was originally uploaded.

You do not need to upload webp images to the filemanager, and actually that would be a bad thing to do as you would lose the fallback functionality HS gives you for free."

<@U7SL518D6> Is this also true for CSS background images? I am seeing these come through as jpeg.

Yes. You will not see a file extension change in the URL.
WebP  will be served to browsers that support it  if the file size of the webp version is smaller.

To better explain an image will have the URL: <http://example.com/image.jpg>
but the image returned is a webp. The switching happens server-side

I accidentally created a new set of landing pages in the landing pages section instead of Content Staging > Landing Pages. Is there a way for me to move these to Content Staging or do I have to delete them and recreate them in Content Staging?
Just stage them.
I don't see that option. My gut is telling me I might have to publish them and then move them?
If it was me I would publish them password protected so that nobody can visit them and then stage them
Thats what I was thinking. Thanks!

In case it helps anyone else. the steps are:
1. Publish your page live (password protected)
2. Go to the Content Staging area
3. Make sure you are on the right staging area in the dropdown 
4. Click Unmodified in the left pane
5. Hover over the Page you want to stage and click the "Stage" button. 
6. Select Stage Cloned Page. 
7. Now unpublish your live page.
I'm going to rename my live draft pages and change the URLs so nothing wonky happens when I move from staging to production.

Suggestion: Update the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cms-general/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging?KBOpenTab#redesign-your-pages|Stage a Clone of an Existing Page> to include the steps of publishing draft pages and finding them in Content Staging. I expected to find the Stage button when I hovered over my page in the production environment so it took me a bit to figure out I had to go to staging and figure out where it was over there.  Though, in fairness, I'm sure other people don't accidentally create their new pages in production :wink:
